verses.roman:
guṇe doṣodgāra-cchale sabā niṣedhiyā
ekākī bhramibena tīrtha vairāgya kariyā

synonyms: guṇe—in the good qualities; doṣa-udgāra-chale—on the plea of attributing faults; sabā—all of them; niṣedhiyā—forbidding; ekākī—alone; bhramibena—will tour; tīrtha—the sacred places of pilgrimage; vairāgya—regulative principles of the renounced order of life; kariyā—observing.
translation: Therefore, to prevent them from accompanying Him and becoming unhappy, Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu declared their good qualities to be faults.

purport.content: The Lord wanted to tour all the places of pilgrimage alone and strictly observe the duties of the renounced order.
